reviewText: OMG where in the world did they get these actors? They did a beautiful job. It was heartbreaking to see them act out what the Walshes went through. I truly admire the Walshes for triumphing over their horrible tragedy. Wow, John Walsh had a son who looked a lot like Adam if you notice in the portrait of the real Walsh family at the end. Every child is loved individually though...I am so glad they didn't just give up on their marriage...on life...etc. They have touched many lives. I SO appreciate what they have done. God bless Adam and his family!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I remember reading about this when I was a young adult and was so heartbroken for the family. Before Adam, child abductions were almost unheard of, and unfortunately today it seems to be the norm.  The acting and writing of this movie is superb, and to watch this without tears is almost impossible.  To have endured such a tragedy as the Walsh family did, and to not only survive but to dedicate your life to fighting for the rights of all children is beyond remarkable. I applaud this movie, and the family who were so courageous to allow their story to be told!

reviewText: Very satisfied with this DVD.  I have been waiting for years to see it on TV but it hasn't been on.  I was so happy to see it again.  The work that John Walsh has done is just incredible.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Back in the early eighties,I and my sister saw this movie.Daniel J.Travanti and Jobeth Williams were two of the most excellent of actors ever have we seen! And the little boy Adam in the movie-he seems to so sweet.And when he came up missing-I was very,very sure that this worried that couple very much! The real sad part of this movie was when they found out what happened to him--(I don't want to even speak about the details)- the poor father just went into a fit-and with the poor wife standing there helplessly bursting into tears! You know-we are living in a time where children are no longer safe! There are a lot of evil monsters out there just ready to harm these innocent children because they don't know any better! Parents-please love your children-talk to them about what is going on,and what to expect.I was very,very happy to find that the movie was on DVD! Though the case was a little damaged,the DVD is the most important to me.I want to be able to see the movie.Thank you so much for having this movie on DVD,and sending it on time. Just watch it--if you're easily moved to tears,then you know that this is enough to tear your heart out!
summary: Enough To Rip Your Heart Out!

reviewText: It was so heartbreaking to watch how much these parents fought to find Adam only to be devastated to learn that he was murdered. This is a must-see for everyone who has children or who doesn't have children.  I wish this movie would come out on DVD.  Also, the movie "ADAM: his song continues"  I happened to see it on LMN.  We all must never forget Adam and what he represents.  His tragic death probably has saved many children from his fate.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Wow, what a moving movie.  Daniel J. Travanti is surprising as is JoBeth Williams.  It's easy to forget that, before Adam disappeared, there was no national search for missing children that parents could rely on.  Still, it's amazing to think that the FBI would search for missing vehicles but not kids.  Thankfully, through their unspeakable tragedy, John and Reve' Walsh changed this problem, and they still fight for missing kids today.  I doubt I would be as generous as they have been, if I'd been in their situation.  This movie is very sad but very well done.

reviewText: Daniel J. Travanti and JoBeth Williams star in the heartbreaking true story of John and Reve Walsh whose 6-year-old son Adam disappears one day while at a shopping mall with his mother.Within hours local police mobilize a massive search for the missing child. But to their surprise the Walshes find that there is no federal agency willing to join in the search.As hopes of finding Adam dim, John Walsh overcomes his deep despair by becoming an advocate for parents of missing children and lobbying in Congress for the Federal Missing Children Act. Walsh later went on to host the long-running TV series "America's Most Wanted".This TV Movie also takes me back to memory lane to when I was 11 years old in the 5th grade when it was shown for the very first time on NBC in the Fall of 1983 when Daniel J. Travanti was still playing Capt. Frank Furillo on the police drama HILL STREET BLUES when that show was in its 4th Season.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I can remember buying this movie on VHS over twenty years ago.  At the time I deemed it unwatchable, not for the subject matter which is painful to watch, but because it was recorded as SLP speed, which meant crappy picture/audio.  So there it sat, until I finally gave it away.  Now...Hen's Tooth Video, obviously a small, independent company, has issued it on DVD.  The picture is decent as well as the sound.  I also glad to report that it is closed=captioned, so my hearing impaired 86-year-old mother can watch it.  Daniel J. Travanti was nominated for an Emmy for his performance as John Walsh, Adam's father.  His heroic efforts got Congress to enact the Federal Missing Children's Act, and of course he went on to host the long-running TV series, "America's Most Wanted." He definitely turned a negative into a positive, albeit at a tragic cost.  JoBeth Williams, the mom in the "Poltergeist" movies, also turns in a moving, heartbreaking performance as the mother of missing Adam.  The film, made for tv and originally airing on NBC, is sometimes unbearable to watch, and I guarantee you will shed more than a few tears.  The running time is 97 min., in color, with full frame.
Title: N/A
